p: West Nile Virus was first characterized in 1937 in the West Nile district of Uganda and was taxonomically placed in the genus Flavivirus within the Flaviviridae family. The virus later appeared in New York in 1999, where it caused 59 hospitalized infections and 7 deaths before its spread to other parts of the USA between 1999â€“2001 [ 50]. WNV survives naturally in a mosquito-bird-mosquito transmission cycle involving the Culex sp. mosquitoes [ 51].
